body: Hi, @kennknowles, @tgroh, can you please take a look?
LGTM. I will merge after tests. Thank you.
Please also rebase to HEAD since there seems to be a merge conflict right now.

Sorry for the delay. I took a high-level look, understood very little, so I'm going to need some guidance to review this.

Can you give some background on what Kinesis is doing, how this is reflected through the Kinesis API, how the current PR is handling that at a high level, and what parts of that are in what classes?
This PR hasn't been updated in a long time - do you plan to continue it?
Is this PR still relevant or should it be closed?
Is this PR still active or should it be closed?
Is this PR still active or should it be closed?
This is likely quite a bit out of date; is it still relevant?
Closing per stale PR policy. Please reopen if needed.
Is this PR still relevant or should it be closed?
side note: the recently released Flink 1.4.0 only has Scala 2.11 support
I think it is, because it cleans up the code base and makes it easier to implement future stuff.
So this is kinda made unnecessary by #4208

@charlesccychen @chamikaramj hope is good now for your review.

Thanks.
@amitsela just rebased after the move to spark 2. Should be now ready to merge. PTAL.
Rebased and added the gradle build. I'm working on adding the `readAll` pattern support.
Thanks for the contribution. I will take a look, it looks interesting !

Thanks. LGTM.

We should also support 3.6, but this is can be done in a follow-up PR.
Waiting on tests, and will merge once relevant tests are green.
Parameterized the Jenkins job with the label and url with the defaults being the nightly build, which should allow running against a staged artifact too.

For now, I'd suggest to just place the file next to boot.go (and change the package to main). These helpers are python specific and could just be local helper functions, similarly to the ones already there: https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/sdks/python/container/boot.go#L112/.

Multiple files are fine and you can change boot.go at the same time.
LGTM. We need to be careful to not call the zig-zag encoding "VarInt" to avoid confusion with the VarInt used elsewhere.
LGTM, was about to fix this myself. Thanks.
LGTM. (This looks unrelated to the issue in mentioned in the title.)
If you tried to build in a repo affected by the issue and it generated pb2 files, then you'd still get an error even after the fix, until you forced their regeneration.

R: @lukecwik 

Executing runner validation tests now via:
```
mvn clean && mvn install -T1C -DskipTests && mvn install -Pvalidates-runner-tests -f runners/google-cloud-dataflow-java
```

FYI, the tests all fail with:

```
java.lang.IllegalStateException: The test was annotated with a [@NeedsRunner] / [@ValidatesRunner] while the runner was set to [CrashingRunner]. Please re-check your configuration.
```

What is the correct command to run these tests?

Alright, let me know when it's ready for review.

For now I have a few comments:

- The interface seems *very* similar to AvroIO. That means perhaps it should be pretty much identical (e.g. allow reading using Avro generated classes, allow not specifying the schema etc.) - WDYT? Or perhaps replicating the API service of AvroIO would be too much work - but then what would be the minimum useful subset?

- Splitting within a file appears to be lacking, which could be a serious performance issue. It would be good to have at least basic splitting into reasonably-sized chunks, even if not dynamic splitting (which would require BoundedSource and going via ReadViaFileBasedSource).

Suggest closure.

@chamikaramj @jasonkuster thanks for the feedback, PTAL now. Thanks
Hi @chamikaramj, please merge this PR, @sduskis approved it. Thanks.

@herohde PTAL. I tested this with a job. 

(Python failure is unrelated to this change. There is no python sdk change in this PR.)

`mvn clean verify` failed due to an error when running the Python SDK tests.

From what I can see, the [Jenkins WordCount test](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_Java_GradleBuild/627/testReport/org.apache.beam.examples/WordCountIT/) failed for the Apex runner.
Is the Java failure related to this change?
I believe this is failing with https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-3369 and not related to this PR. Merging.
I've pushed my new changes, along with test, and cythonization. This should be ready for review.
@chamikaramj PTAL, this is small hotfix for #4267 merged yesterday.
The changes look good! I'm rerunning tests to see if this is flaky or a real problem but it cannot be caused by these changed.
LGTM but waiting for green gradle build.
